name: Acalypha indica
Relationship: Compare: Mill; Phos.; Acetic acid; Kali-n.

Abdomen: SPLUTTERING DIARRHEA WITH FORCIBLE EXPULSION OF NOISY FLATUS, bearing down pains and tenesmus
Rumbling distention, and griping pain in abdomen
Chest: COUGH DRY, HARD, FOLLOWED BY HEMOPTYSIS; worse in morning and at night
Constant and severe pain in chest
Blood bright red and not profuse in morning; dark and clotted in afternoon
Burning in pharynx, oesophagus, and Stomach

details: A drug having a marked action on the alimentary canal and respiratory organs. It is indicated in incipient phthisis, with hard, racking cough, bloody expectoration, arterial hemorrhage, but no febrile disturbance. Very weak in the morning, gains strength during day. Progressive emaciation. All pathological hemorrhages having notably a MORNING AGGRAVATION.
